segments.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You accepted presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Only a trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I remember it well, covered in diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, not at all.  I-I still have it.  I wear it quite often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit that he was in love with you, wasn't he?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: maybe just a little, but--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, I- he got a lot of pleasure out of it and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, if you hadn't been so nosey and suspicious, you never would have heard about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm growing quite tired and bored of this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I, bored stiff.  Would you like some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have a little I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see why you want any.  You've already had three glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason, besides, they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, it seems silly to go on and on in such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three liqueur glasses of brandy in a whole evening going on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's becoming a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand simply because you don't happen to want any at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Going out somewhere, dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, that reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's the woman's job to allure the man.  Why don't you watch me for a moment?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: As a matter of fact, that is perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, it's not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, yes it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, Do shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's a pity you didn't take a little more brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Um, It doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, snap, snap, snap like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: adder don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nonsense, they have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care if they bark and roll around like hoops, okay.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [BREATHING]
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after the divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did quite a bit.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must have a riotous time, no restraint at all, very enjoyable.  I mean, you never had much anyway.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh dear, you really are becoming quite insufferable.  I would imagine it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm not the least bit drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I think I mentioned once before that I had only three-minute liqueur glasses of brandy the entire evening long.  A child of two could not be drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh no, on the contrary, a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, very interesting.  How about a child of three or a child of six?  How about a child of nine?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, You are so insufferable.  Do you stop.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, This is very interesting.  We- we might get a splendid debate going about this intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very funny, dear, you better have some more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, very good idea.  I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Ugh.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You better turn that off I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's very late and it will disturb the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There aren't any people upstairs; it's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, there are people downstairs I suppose.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They're away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It is not time of year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Fine, if you insist on being completely insolent.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.  It is driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, do try to control yourself darling.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You really do need to develop uh a clearer head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I- I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda-- Listen- Listen-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, no.  I'm tired of listening to you.  You're boorish and idiotic and completely overbearing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very music- amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, very amusing.  Let me go.  I'm getting out of here.  I can't believe I intended to marry you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You are a vile tempered, loose living, wicked little beast, and I never want to set eyes on you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, marry you again?  I must have been insane.  What was I thinking?  I mean, you're completely outrageous.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up, shut up.  I wouldn't marry you again if you came crawling to me on bended knee. You're a mean, evil-minded little vampire and I hope to God I never set eyes on you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Beast; brute; cad; whore
segments.speaker: F
